[Back to Table of Contents](./README.md) :blue_book:

## Lab10 - Create the Root Trust Policy

### RootTrustPolicy

This will create a new secret in the management cluster called `root-trust-policy.gloo-mesh`.

```
‚ùØ k get secret -n gloo-mesh root-trust-policy.gloo-mesh -oyaml
apiVersion: v1
data:
  ca-cert.pem: 
  ca-key.pem: 
  cert-chain.pem: 
  root-cert.pem: 
kind: Secret
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: "2022-04-02T11:35:02Z"
  labels:
    context.mesh.gloo.solo.io/cluster: ""
    context.mesh.gloo.solo.io/namespace: gloo-mesh
    gloo.solo.io/parent_cluster: mgmt
    gloo.solo.io/parent_group: admin.gloo.solo.io
    gloo.solo.io/parent_kind: RootTrustPolicy
    gloo.solo.io/parent_name: root-trust-policy
    gloo.solo.io/parent_namespace: gloo-mesh
    gloo.solo.io/parent_version: v2
    reconciler.mesh.gloo.solo.io/name: translator
  name: root-trust-policy.gloo-mesh
  namespace: gloo-mesh
  resourceVersion: "357616"
  uid: 15e7a977-5c0b-424b-99b3-d726907d72f5
type: admin.gloo.solo.io/generated_signing_cert
```

In the remote cluster, you will see an `IssuedCertificate`.  Let's take a look.

```
‚ùØ k get issuedcertificate -n istio-system istiod-1-12-istio-system-cluster1 -oyaml
apiVersion: internal.gloo.solo.io/v2
kind: IssuedCertificate
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: "2022-04-02T11:35:02Z"
  generation: 1
  labels:
    agent.gloo.solo.io: gloo-mesh
    cluster.multicluster.solo.io: ""
    context.mesh.gloo.solo.io/cluster: cluster1
    context.mesh.gloo.solo.io/namespace: istio-system
    gloo.solo.io/parent_cluster: mgmt
    gloo.solo.io/parent_group: admin.gloo.solo.io
    gloo.solo.io/parent_kind: RootTrustPolicy
    gloo.solo.io/parent_name: root-trust-policy
    gloo.solo.io/parent_namespace: gloo-mesh
    gloo.solo.io/parent_version: v2
    owner.gloo.solo.io/name: gloo-mesh
    reconciler.mesh.gloo.solo.io/name: translator
    relay.solo.io/cluster: cluster1
  name: istiod-1-12-istio-system-cluster1
  namespace: istio-system
  resourceVersion: "458454"
  uid: 946d80ae-e82f-49cc-9242-0dac88b69db4
spec:
  autoRestartPods: true
  certOptions:
    orgName: Istio
    rsaKeySizeBytes: 4096
    secretRotationGracePeriodRatio: 0.1
    ttlDays: 365
  hosts:
  - cluster1/ns/istio-system/sa/istiod-1-12
  issuedCertificateSecret:
    name: cacerts
    namespace: istio-system
  meshRef:
    name: istiod-1-12-istio-system-cluster1
    namespace: gloo-mesh
  mgmtServerCa:
    signingCertificateSecret:
      name: root-trust-policy.gloo-mesh
      namespace: gloo-mesh
status:
  observedGeneration: 1
  state: FINISHED
```

Inspecting this object gives us some idea of the `RootTrustPolicy` configuration.  We can see that `autoRestartPods` is true by default.  Next, we see that the intermediate signing cert has a lifecycle of 365 days.  We also see that it created the `cacerts` secret in the istio-system namespace.

```
‚ùØ k get secret -n istio-system cacerts -oyaml                                     
apiVersion: v1
data:
  ca-cert.pem: 
  ca-key.pem: 
  cert-chain.pem: 
  root-cert.pem: 
kind: Secret
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: "2022-04-02T11:35:22Z"
  labels:
    context.mesh.gloo.solo.io/cluster: cluster1
    context.mesh.gloo.solo.io/namespace: istio-system
    gloo.solo.io/parent_cluster: cluster1
    gloo.solo.io/parent_group: internal.gloo.solo.io
    gloo.solo.io/parent_kind: IssuedCertificate
    gloo.solo.io/parent_name: istiod-1-12-istio-system-cluster1
    gloo.solo.io/parent_namespace: istio-system
    gloo.solo.io/parent_version: v2
    reconciler.mesh.gloo.solo.io/name: cert-agent
  name: cacerts
  namespace: istio-system
  resourceVersion: "458247"
  uid: 4b316d1e-f1fd-4b62-88f0-0831a575e085
type: internal.gloo.solo.io/issued_certificate
```

Again, the traceability is maintained with gloo metadata.labels on this secret.
